column5: I was wondering if anyone on the board had any experience using these knotable stainless leader materials?  Any advice is appreciated.  Any of you musky guys out there using this?  If so, what pound test are you using? Is the 130 easy to tie?
ive used tyger for adding stinger trebles to muskie jigs or plastics but it was around 50#, It was good stuff. I would not use it as a leader though. I like flourocarbon. Landry

I used the Courtland stuff about 6 or 7 years ago... It was okay, but I felt it was more for fly fishers than plug casters. As I recall, I wasn't really able to tie a proper knot. I did sort of a haywire-twist, then "set" it by heating it with a match.
If you want to tie your own leaders at 130ln go floro all the way.
